It is featured prominently in the works of artist M. C. Escher, whose earlier depictions of impossible objects partly inspired it.
question: Is it true that Roger Penrose did not give name to Penrose triangle?
llm_answer:
Answer:
    Yes, because Roger Penrose did not give name to Penrose triangle. The Penrose triangle is named after mathematician Roger Penrose and his wife, artist Liliane Penrose, who independently discovered the triangle in the 1950s. The Penrose triangle is also known as the Penrose tiling, which is a set of two tiles that can be arranged in a repeating pattern to form an aperiodic tiling. The Penrose tiling was discovered by Roger Penrose and his father, mathematician Lionel Penrose, in the 1970s.

description: In mathematics, the Kadison–Kastler metric is a metric on the space of C*-algebras on a fixed Hilbert space. It is the Hausdorff distance between the unit balls of the two C*-algebras, under the norm-induced metric on the space of all bounded operators on that Hilbert space.
question: Is it true that Richard Kadison did not give name to Kadison–Kastler metric?
llm_answer:
Answer:
    Yes, because Richard Kadison did not give name to Kadison–Kastler metric. The Kadison–Kastler metric is named after Richard Kadison and John Kastler, who independently discovered it in the 1950s.
